title: Australian Ex-Childcare Worker Pleads Guilty To Sexually Abusing 60 Girls
content: Former childcare worker Ashley Paul Griffith on Monday pleaded guilty to raping, sexually abusing and exploiting dozens of girls under his care in Australia and Italy.
summary: Former childcare worker Ashley Paul Griffith on Monday pleaded guilty to raping, sexually abusing and exploiting dozens of girls under his care in Australia and Italy.

title: George Clooney Praises Joe Biden For Dropping Out Of US Presidential Race
content: Hollywood star George Clooney has heaped praise on US President Joe Biden over the latter's decision to step down from the 2024 presidential race.
summary: Hollywood star George Clooney has heaped praise on US President Joe Biden over the latter's decision to step down from the 2024 presidential race.

title: Why Are Food Allergies Rising Among Children In UK
content: The number of people in England with food allergies has more than doubled between 2008 and 2018, a new study reveals.
summary: The number of people in England with food allergies has more than doubled between 2008 and 2018, a new study reveals.

title: US Man Jumps Off Bridge, Falls On Car's Windshield. Passenger Dies
content: A California grandmother died  after a suicidal man jumped from a highway overpass onto the windshield of her car.
summary: A California grandmother died  after a suicidal man jumped from a highway overpass onto the windshield of her car.

title: Elon Musk's Big Reveal On How X Algorithm Works
content: If you've been wondering why you see only a certain kind of content on your X feed, its owner Elon Musk has the answer. The billionaire, in a post on Monday, shed light on the platform's inner workings.
summary: If you've been wondering why you see only a certain kind of content on your X feed, its owner Elon Musk has the answer. The billionaire, in a post on Monday, shed light on the platform's inner workings.

title: Malaysia, New Zealand PMs Call For Immediate Gaza Truce, Two-State Solution
content: Malaysia Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim and his New Zealand counterpart Chris Luxon on Monday said they were united in calling for an immediate ceasefire in the conflict in Gaza and finding a two-state solution between Israel and Palestine.
summary: Malaysia Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim and his New Zealand counterpart Chris Luxon on Monday said they were united in calling for an immediate ceasefire in the conflict in Gaza and finding a two-state solution between Israel and Palestine.

title: South Korea Launches Probe Into Telegram Over Online Sex Crimes
content: South Korean police have launched an investigation into the messaging platform Telegram over deepfake online sex crimes, Yonhap news agency reported on Monday, citing a senior police official.
summary: South Korean police have launched an investigation into the messaging platform Telegram over deepfake online sex crimes, Yonhap news agency reported on Monday, citing a senior police official.

title: Putin Accuses West Of Openly Persecuting Russian Journalists
content: The West is openly persecuting Russian journalists, President Vladimir Putin said in remarks published on Monday, days after Moscow banned dozens of US journalists from entering the country.
summary: The West is openly persecuting Russian journalists, President Vladimir Putin said in remarks published on Monday, days after Moscow banned dozens of US journalists from entering the country.

title: Black Sororities Could Be Key Advantage For Kamala Harris' Presidential Bid
content: As Kamala Harris heads into the November presidential race against Donald Trump, a social club she joined in college four decades ago might just pay its biggest dividends yet.
summary: As Kamala Harris heads into the November presidential race against Donald Trump, a social club she joined in college four decades ago might just pay its biggest dividends yet.

title: Brazil's Top Court Justices To Vote on Elon Musk's X Ban
content: A five-member panel of Brazil's Supreme Court will vote on Monday on whether to uphold Justice Alexandre de Moraes' ruling to shut down social media platform X in the country.
summary: A five-member panel of Brazil's Supreme Court will vote on Monday on whether to uphold Justice Alexandre de Moraes' ruling to shut down social media platform X in the country.

title: Watch: Karachi's Dream Bazaar Mall Ransacked, Looted By Mob On Opening Day
content: People frantically grabbed whatever they could lay their hands on, shoving them into bags or carrying them away in their arms.
summary: People frantically grabbed whatever they could lay their hands on, shoving them into bags or carrying them away in their arms.

title: Intel CEO To Unveil Cost-Cutting Plan In September Meeting
content: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger and key executives are expected to present a plan later this month to the company's board of directors to slice off unnecessary businesses and revamp capital spending.
summary: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger and key executives are expected to present a plan later this month to the company's board of directors to slice off unnecessary businesses and revamp capital spending.

title: Lebanese Forces Chief Condemns Hezbollah On Fight With Israel
content: The head of the Christian political party Lebanese Forces on Sunday accused Hezbollah of dragging the country into a war with Israel without consulting the people.
summary: The head of the Christian political party Lebanese Forces on Sunday accused Hezbollah of dragging the country into a war with Israel without consulting the people.

title: "Paid The Worst Price": Israeli Families Bury Hostages Recovered From Gaza
content: The families of Israeli hostages whose bodies were recovered from Gaza sobbed as they laid their relatives to rest on Sunday at funerals that featured heartfelt eulogies alongside expressions of frustration with the government.
summary: The families of Israeli hostages whose bodies were recovered from Gaza sobbed as they laid their relatives to rest on Sunday at funerals that featured heartfelt eulogies alongside expressions of frustration with the government.

title: 11 Killed In Israeli Strike On School Sheltering Displaced Palestinians
content: Gaza health officials said an Israeli air strike targeting a group of policemen in a school sheltering displaced Palestinians killed at least 11 people on Sunday, while the military said it had struck a Hamas command centre.
summary: Gaza health officials said an Israeli air strike targeting a group of policemen in a school sheltering displaced Palestinians killed at least 11 people on Sunday, while the military said it had struck a Hamas command centre.

title: Kharkiv Hit By Missiles After Ukraine Launches Mass Drone Attack On Russia
content: At least 47 people, including five children, were injured on Sunday after Russian missiles struck a shopping mall and events complex in Ukraine's northeastern city of Kharkiv, officials said.
summary: At least 47 people, including five children, were injured on Sunday after Russian missiles struck a shopping mall and events complex in Ukraine's northeastern city of Kharkiv, officials said.

title: Russia Says Repelled "Massive" Ukrainian Drone Attack On Energy Plants
content: Russia said Sunday it had repelled a "massive" Ukrainian drone attack on energy and fuel plants in Moscow and 14 regions, one of the largest such strikes since the start of the two and half-year conflict.
summary: Russia said Sunday it had repelled a "massive" Ukrainian drone attack on energy and fuel plants in Moscow and 14 regions, one of the largest such strikes since the start of the two and half-year conflict.

title: Fires In Brazil's Amazon Rainforest In August Highest Since 2010
content: The number of fires in Brazil's Amazon rainforest region for the month of August surged to the highest level since 2010, government data showed on Sunday, after a record drought that has been plaguing the biome.
summary: The number of fires in Brazil's Amazon rainforest region for the month of August surged to the highest level since 2010, government data showed on Sunday, after a record drought that has been plaguing the biome.

title: Helicopter Of Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi Crashed Due To Weather: Probe
content: Iran's final investigation into the May helicopter crash that killed president Ebrahim Raisi has found it was caused by bad weather, the body investigating the case said Sunday.
summary: Iran's final investigation into the May helicopter crash that killed president Ebrahim Raisi has found it was caused by bad weather, the body investigating the case said Sunday.

title: Israel Main Labour Union Orders Complete Strike After Hostages Found Dead
content: The head of Israel's powerful Histadrut trade union ordered a "complete strike" in support of Gaza hostages on Monday and urged a deal to secure their release after the bodies of six captives were recovered.
summary: The head of Israel's powerful Histadrut trade union ordered a "complete strike" in support of Gaza hostages on Monday and urged a deal to secure their release after the bodies of six captives were recovered.
